info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 07 at 5:46PM EDT until July 07 at 7:30PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 645 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Georgia and central South Carolina, including the following counties, in east central Georgia, Lincoln. In central South Carolina, Edgefield and McCormick. * WHEN...Until 645 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 544 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... McCormick, Lincolnton, Elijah Clark State Park, Mccormick County Airport, Plum Branch, Baker Creek State Park, Long Cane Creek Picnic Area, Bordeaux, Hickory Knob State Resort Park, Hawe Creek Campground, Willington, Leroy`s Ferry Recreation Area, New Hope, Curry Hill, Double Branches, Knox Scout Reservation, Mount Carmel, Mount Carmel Park, Whitetown and Hester`s Ferry Campground. - Streams across northern Lincoln and McCormick counties will see rises due to the locally heavy rainfall. These include Sawney Creek, Little River and Calhoun Creek. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Most flooding deaths occur in vehicles. Never drive through a flooded roadway or around barricades. Turn around, don`t drown.
